coda.base 0.2.2

    • Working with log-ratio coordinates in `coda.base`

Distance Matrix Computation (including Aitchison distance)

Source: R/coordinates.R
dist.Rd

This function overwrites dist function to contain Aitchison distance between compositions.

dist(x, method = "euclidean", ...)

Arguments

x

compositions method
method

the distance measure to be used. This must be one of "aitchison", "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra", "binary" or "minkowski". Any unambiguous substring can be given.
...

arguments passed to dist function

Value

dist returns an object of class "dist".

See also

See functions dist.

Examples

X = exp(matrix(rnorm(10*50), ncol=50, nrow=10))

(d <- dist(X, method = 'aitchison'))
#>            1         2         3         4         5         6         7
#> 2  10.015738                                                            
#> 3  10.859322  9.530935                                                  
#> 4  10.965314  9.392665  7.948979                                        
#> 5  10.665198  9.692473  8.545370  9.771443                              
#> 6  11.512275 10.366209 10.284665 10.160655 10.597639                    
#> 7  10.869140  9.677432  9.440641 10.227427 10.569347 10.738396          
#> 8  10.082063 10.184597  9.562470  9.892347 10.363223  9.922811  9.894500
#> 9  11.255150  9.773053  9.629235  9.459595 10.391876 11.074228  8.952787
#> 10 11.748855 10.600938 10.486119 10.889945 10.671511 10.885584 10.060332
#>            8         9
#> 2                     
#> 3                     
#> 4                     
#> 5                     
#> 6                     
#> 7                     
#> 8                     
#> 9   9.215463          
#> 10 11.784437 11.234993
plot(hclust(d))

# In contrast to Euclidean distance
dist(rbind(c(1,1,1), c(100, 100, 100)), method = 'euc') # method = 'euclidean'
#>         1
#> 2 171.473
# using Aitchison distance, only relative information is of importance
dist(rbind(c(1,1,1), c(100, 100, 100)), method = 'ait') # method = 'aitchison'
#>             1
#> 2 6.28037e-16
